review_blob: Bottle serving.  Pours a very nice-looking mahogany, with a big cream-coloured head.  The aroma is sweet caramel and coffee: very striking indeed.  The taste is very dry, and with lovely sweet notes, and with a dry finish and no bitterness in aftertaste. A very enjoyable beer indeed.

330ml bottle serving.
Quite a subtle aroma: citrus and spicy, but not in large amounts.  The appearance is dense cloudiness, with a fine white head.  Has quite a watery taste, a little too sweet.  Rather an uninspiring beer.

Pours a rich amber/golden colour, with a minimal white head.  The aroma is of strong citrus and grapefruit, with something a little more earthy in the mix.  The taste is relatively light and malty, with abundant hops, but seems well balanced overall.  A very solid (and delicious) example of an IPA.

Lovely caramel/toffee nose and actually quite fruity in places.  Appearance is a rich deep red/darkbrown hue: very appealing, with a big frothy head.  The taste reminded me somewhat of Belgian dubbels or tripels: deep, rich and quite earthy. The finish was perhaps just a fraction too quickly gone for me, but otherwise this is absolutely delicious and I wish there were more than the limited small batch of 1481 bottles produced...
beer_name: Black Isle Small Batch Export Scotch Ale (7.9%)
